description:
ISBI 360 is seeking exceptional talent to join our dynamic Sales Leadership Team. With a proven track record of developing top-performing sales professionals for premier sports organizations, we are committed to identifying the best and brightest candidates to drive our continued growth and success.

Our Virtual Sales Network has established itself as a trailblazer in the industry, partnering with over 70 professional sports teams and properties. We have placed over 120 talented individuals in full-time positions, including esteemed roles such as Sr. Director of Ticket Sales & Service at the WNBA, Director of Season Membership Sales at the NHL, Director of the ISBI Virtual Sales Network at ISBI360, and Manager of Ticket Sales at the MLS.

We are currently seeking a Ticket Sales Manager to play a pivotal role in selling as well as training and developing our exceptional sales talent. Working alongside renowned sales trainers Bill Guertin and Noah Heiber, you will lead our sales teams, conduct training sessions, and personally mentor hundreds of sales representatives annually.

The ideal candidate is a current Account Executive who feels constrained in their current role and seeks an opportunity to expand their management expertise and direct sales training experience. This position offers a unique chance to develop into a leader within the esteemed professional sports industry, capitalizing on our proven track record of nurturing top talent.

At ISBI 360, we are committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, accessibility, and inclusion. Our diversity initiatives begin with the recruitment and selection process, and we welcome all diverse candidates to apply for opportunities within our team.

Key Responsibilities:
- Lead and mentor 3-5 sales representatives across 2-3 of our team partnerships, ensuring their growth and success.
- Generate new ticket sales through the sale of full season, partial season, group tickets, and hospitality areas with our partner teams.
- Track and monitor performance metrics and weekly sales activity for your teams, providing guidance and support to drive exceptional results.
- Ensure accurate and efficient data entry, reporting, and pipeline management within our CRM platform.
- Embody an optimistic, team-first attitude, coupled with a competitive drive to be the best.
- Demonstrate professionalism, strong interpersonal skills, positivity, prompt follow-through, and openness to new ideas and suggestions in all interactions.

Qualifications:
- Bachelor's degree or actively working towards one with a confirmed graduation date.
- Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
- Willingness to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
- Previous sales experience is required; previous leadership experience is a valuable asset but not mandatory.

If you are a driven sales professional with a passion for training and developing top talent, we invite you to apply for this exciting leadership opportunity. Join our team and contribute to shaping the future of sales excellence in the professional sports industry.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, disability, gender identity, marital or veteran status, or any other protected class. Please note that due to current state employment laws, residents of the state of California are ineligible for this opportunity.
